VOLUNTEER
Be one of us and spread love to the world!

Why do you want to volunteer for CLIMAT:
Comments from Our Precious Volunteers
We strive to give each volunteer the best volunteer experience possible. Let's take a look at the feedback from our volunteers.
Sebastian
Resource Administrator
It has been a wonderful experience working with the Climat Foundation crew. Due to my volunteer role, I learned a lot of new things from the staff, especially resource management, which will help me in my future management career. I will recommend the Climate Foundation Volunteer Program to friends and attend many more volunteer events they host in the future.
Christopher
Junior Civil Engineer
As a fresh graduate, I was initially concerned that my inexperience would cause trouble for the rebuilding team. However, the members there were really helpful and always patiently explained construction methods that I was unfamiliar with. If you are a junior civil engineer looking to contribute to your community, the Climat Foundation is the best choice.
Valentine
Teacher
It has been a fun and exciting experience working with the Climat Education team to provide free education to children in disaster areas. Their love for children knows no bounds, melts my heart, and inspires me as a teacher. If you want to contribute to your community, try the Climat Foundation Volunteer Program.
Oliver
Medical Assistant
Rescue operations are indeed a difficult and dangerous task, especially in disaster areas where there are many uncertainties. Nonetheless, the arrangements and cooperation between the Climat Foundation and the official bodies are flawless. As a volunteer medical assistant there, I can focus on helping the injured without worrying about other factors because the Climat Foundation will manage them well. I will join them again in the future.
VOLUNTEER FAQs
  • What are the requirements to become a volunteer?
    • There are no requirements to become a Climat Foundation volunteer. However, some specific volunteer roles, such as medical assistant and engineer for building reconstruction, will only be assigned to qualified individuals.
  • Will I receive volunteer training?
    • Yes. To ensure you have the information and skills you need for your volunteer role, we provide you with training and guidance before you start volunteering. The type of training required depends on what the volunteer is doing. Our staff will provide you with advice, tools, and support throughout your volunteer experience.
  • Can I volunteer if I am under 18 years old?
    • Yes. Individuals under the age of 18 can volunteer with us. However, according to our guidelines, certain roles may require parental consent to ensure a positive experience for young volunteers. Some roles may also have age restrictions to ensure the safety of young volunteers.
  • Can I volunteer with a criminal record?
    • Yes. We are open to anyone in the community, even those with criminal records. However, depending on the nature of your criminal record, you may be restricted from some volunteer roles.
  • How much time do I need to devote as a volunteer?
    • The time commitment required depends on the specific volunteer role and your availability. Some volunteer roles may require several hours per week, while others may be project-based. We will strive to find the best volunteer roles that align with your availability.
  • Can I quit my volunteer role at any time?
    • Yes. You can quit your volunteer role at any time. If you have any unpleasant experiences, you can always seek advice from our counsellors. If you encounter any terrible things while volunteering, you can make a complaint to our advisors. If you do not like your current role, you can contact our advisors and request to switch your volunteer role.
  • Can I volunteer with my family and friends?
    • Absolutely. You can volunteer with people close to you. Indeed, we encourage you to do so. If you want to work with someone close to you, you can ask our consultants to assign you to your desired project or event.
  • Will the Climat Foundation pay for my transportation and other expenses?
    • Yes. Our volunteers can reimburse out-of-pocket expenses such as travel or meals. However, the reimbursement amount is limited. Details can be found in the terms and conditions. If you need additional financial help, you can contact our advisors for help and advice.
